lines.text: How do they do it?
How do we watch it?
*Why* do we watch it?

[Breaking the fourth wall]
Why do *you* watch it?
These seats are awful.
Why? Can't you see anything?
That's the problem. I can see everything.
Just when you think this show is terrible something wonderful happens.
What?
It ends.
What's the difference between illegal and immoral?
Immoral is something that's not right and illegal is me with a tummy ache.

[Sam's dance partner looks at the camera in disgust]
I didn't write it.
Well, you gotta give them credit.
Why's that?
Well, they're gonna keep on doing it till they get it right.
This show is awful.
Terrible.
Disgusting.
See you next week?
Of course.
Please don't make me watch it.
[repeated line]
And now, "Veterinarian's Hospital". The continuing storrrrry of a quack who's gone to the dogs.
Methinks thou doth protest too much.
What?
Shakespeare.
Sounds more like Bacon. From a ham.
How would you like a pork chop? Hi-yah!
[karate chops Kermit]
You always hurt the one you love.
Ladies and gentlemen, it's the Muppet Show!
Now why did you do that to poor Fozzie?
Do what? I really was on the Titanic.
I know. You still have the dress you wore so they'd let you in the life boat. Heh heh heh.
D'oh!
Animal, you like the theme song, don't you?

[nods head emphatically]
Yeah, yeah!
No, no!

[shakes head emphatically]
No, no.
Tell me, Statler. Do you have any naval experience?
Well, I once saved a rat from drowning.
Really, how?
I gave him mouth to mouse resuscitation!

[as Nurse Piggy]
It's too late, Doctor Bob. We've lost him.

[as Doctor Bob]
Well, he couldn't have gone far. He was under the sheet just a second ago.
I like that last number.
What did you like about it?
It was the *last* number!
I wouldn't have believed it if I hadn't watched it.
Believe what?
I don't know - I wasn't watching.
What have you got for an opening act this time? A Chinese gorilla dancing ballet?
Cancel the opening number.
Dong day do dai dai do...
Ever heard of pig on bikes?
I've never heard of road hogs.
But I love him.
How could you love him? You're a nurse.
That may be true, but I am a woman first.
No, you're not. You're a pig first. Nurse second. I don't think woman made the top 10.
Kermit. Kermit. This time I have really got it. I have re-mastered the art of handling hecklers.
Oh, you think so, huh?
Oh, I know so. I know so.
OK, I tell you what - you tell a joke and I will heckle you.
Great.
But, Fozzie - I expect a great comeback.
Right.
[clears throat]
Ahh, my cousin's so dumb he thinks Eggs Benedict's a mafia gangster.
I've seen cheeseburgers funnier then that.
[Fozzie pounds Kermit with a rubber chicken]
What do you think, huh? Too subtle?
Here is a Muppet News Flash.
[runs to the desk]
There is no news tonight.
Hey, did you hear the one about the kangaroo that comes into a store, and a hippopotamus comes out and he says to the kanga
[curtains close]
HEY I WASN'T FINISHED!

[Phone rings]
I'll get it!
[Picks up]
Muppet Show backstage.
[Coins start pouring out of the mike on the phone, and Fozzie takes off his hat quickly to catch them]
Fozzie, who was it this time?
Las Vegas.
[Kermit walks off disgusted]
Well, this show certainly doesn't lay any eggs.
Bwak bawk bawk!
Wanna bet?
And now Pigs in Space. Starring the ever handsome Link Hogwash, the illustrious first mate Miss Piggy, and the scientist Dr Jullius Strangepork. Our story begins when...

[after the song "Happy Feet"]
You know, on the show that wasn't funny.
True, true.
But on a record, it doesn't even make sense!

[after the ending theme plays]
Uh, Statler?
Yeah, what?
Is that it?
Yes, it's over. How'd you like it?
Uh, I don't know. I slept through the whole thing.
Well, you didn't miss much!
Well the show tonight certainly didn't lay an egg.
Bawk!
Wanna bet?
I can't believe those rats were responsible for this show.
Those rats were also responsible for the bubonic plague. Dohohohoh!
Kermit I was wondering if we could just forget the cue cards and just ad lib it.
Ad lib it? Yes I don't mind doing that but there are others who may take offense.
Like who?
Like the guy who holds the cue cards.
Nice lady not want Sweetums to hold cue cards?
Uh no.
Nice lady want Sweetums to hold something else?
Sure you can hold anything you want.
Great! That best offer Sweetums have all week.
[Sweetums picks up Rita like a football and walks off with her while Kermit shrieks]
That's the problem with guests on this show. They seem to get carried away.
I don't got rhythm.
That's for sure.
I don't got rhythm.
Who can ask for anything more?
We could!
Yeah! Earplugs!
And now a man who needs no introduction, so what am I doing out here?
Hey, listen you, how about you and me getting together and makin' some ste-e-e-am heat. Huh, snuggle bunny?
Snuggle bunny? Why, uh...
Yeah. Look, let me take you away from all this. Aaah, a marriage made in heaven. A frog and a pig. We can have bouncing baby figs.
Kermit! Kermit! I had a dream and it was so real! I... what does it mean when you dream people are walking on your head?
It means you're sleeping on the floor!

[the phone rings]
Fozzie, will you get that?

[Runs up and answers it]
Hello. Muppet Show backstage.
[Water squirts out of the mike on the phone]
Who was that?
The water department.
[Hangs up and walks away]

[Towards the camera]
What the hey?

[the phone rings]
I'll get it!
[Picks up]
Muppet Show backstage.
[Thick white smoke comes out of the phone]
Fozzie, who was that?

[Coughing]
The fire department.

[Towards the camera]
I think this is what's called a running gag.
[At that the Muppet Newsman runs by towards the stage]

[Pointing at him]
No, THAT'S what's called a running gag.

[Phone rings]
I got it!
[Answers]
Muppet Show backstage.
[an explosion with bright light comes through the phone's mike]

[a little shaken]
Uh Fozzie, who was it this time?
The Atomic Energy Commission.

[looking down from the balcony]
He shouldn't have jumped. The show wasn't that bad.
And now it's time for Veterinarian's Hospital, the continuing story of an orthopedic surgeon who's gone to the dogs.
You are my sunshine! My only sunshine.
Why you old fool!
What?
I'm not your son and my name's not Shine.
And he calls me an old fool?
Let's all sing the rhyming song, the rhyming song, the rhyming song. Let's take turns and rhyme together... the rhyming song.
I left my niece in your car.
The rhyming song, the rhyming song.
My laundry's ready at half-past nine.
The rhyming song. Oh brother. Link?
The stars are twinkling in the sky.
The rhyming song, the rhyming song.
There's no hot water in my hotel.
The rhyming song.
Pay up! They made it through another one
Double or nothing next week's show?
You're on!
You know I never liked this show's theme music.
Niether did I.
You promised!
